Package camzup.core

Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Gradient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ColorKey>
public class Gradient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ColorKey>
A mutable, extensible class that contains a list of keys which hold colors at steps in the range [0.0, 1.0] . Allows smooth color transitions to be evaluated by a factor.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.TreeSet<ColorKey> keys
    The set of keys.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Gradient()
    Creates a gradient with two default color keys, clear black at 0.0 and opaque white at 1.0.
    Gradient​(float... scalars)
    Creates a gradient from a list of scalars; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
    Gradient​(int color)
    Creates a gradient from a color integer; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(int... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of color integers; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
    Gradient​(Color color)
    Creates a gradient from a color; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(Color... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of colors; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
    Gradient​(ColorKey... keys)
    Creates a gradient from color keys.
    Gradient​(Gradient source)
    Constructs a copy of a source gradient.
    Gradient​(java.lang.String color)
    Creates a gradient from a color string; an additional color key, white at 0.0, is created.
    Gradient​(java.lang.String... colors)
    Creates a gradient from a list of color strings; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].

    • paletteRgb

      public static Gradient paletteRgb​(Gradient target)
      Returns seven primary and secondary colors: red, yellow, green, cyan, blue, magenta and red. Red is repeated so the gradient is periodic.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteRyb

      public static Gradient paletteRyb​(Gradient target)
      Returns a gradient simulating the red-yellow-green color wheel. Red is repeated so the gradient is periodic.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • shiftBri

      public static Gradient shiftBri​(Gradient source, float shift, Gradient target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts the brightness of all colors in a gradient. The brightness is clamped to the range [0.0, 1.0] . The source gradient may either be the same as or different from the target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source gradient
      shift - the brightness shift
      target - the output gradient
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted ramp

    • shiftHsb

      public static Gradient shiftHsb​(Gradient source, Vec4 shift, Gradient target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts the hue, saturation and brightness in a gradient. The alpha remains unaffected.
      Parameters:
      source - the input gradient
      shift - the shift
      target - the output gradient
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted ramp

    • shiftHsba

      public static Gradient shiftHsba​(Gradient source, Vec4 shift, Gradient target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts the hue, saturation and brightness in a gradient.
      Parameters:
      source - the input gradient
      shift - the shift
      target - the output gradient
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted ramp

    • shiftHue

      public static Gradient shiftHue​(Gradient source, float shift, Gradient target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts the hue of all colors in a gradient. The hue wraps around the range [0.0, 1.0] . The source gradient may either be the same as or different from the target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source gradient
      shift - the hue shift
      target - the output gradient
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted ramp

    • shiftSat

      public static Gradient shiftSat​(Gradient source, float shift, Gradient target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts the saturation of all colors in a gradient. The saturation is clamped to the range [0.0, 1.0] . The source gradient may either be the same as or different from the target.
      Parameters:
      source - the source gradient
      shift - the saturation shift
      target - the output gradient
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted ramp

    • eval

      public Color eval​(float step, Color target)
      Finds a color given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When the step falls between color keys, the resultant color is created by an easing function.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      TreeSet.floor(Object), TreeSet.ceiling(Object), TreeSet.first(), TreeSet.last()

    • eval

      public Color eval​(float step, Color.AbstrEasing easing, Color target)
      Finds a color given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0]. When the step falls between color keys, the resultant color is generated by an easing function.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      easing - the easing function
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      TreeSet.floor(Object), TreeSet.ceiling(Object), TreeSet.first(), TreeSet.last()

    • evalRange

      public Color[] evalRange​(int count)
      Evaluates an array of colors given a supplied count.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      Returns:
      the array

    • evalRange

      public Color[] evalRange​(int count, Color.AbstrEasing easing)
      Evaluates an array of colors given a supplied count. The minimum count is three.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      easing - the easing function
      Returns:
      the array

    • findGe

      public ColorKey findGe​(float step)
      Returns the least key in this gradient greater than or equal to the given step. If there is no key, returns the last key instead of null.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the key
      See Also:
      TreeSet.ceiling(Object), TreeSet.last()

    • findLe

      public ColorKey findLe​(float step)
      Returns the greatest key in this gradient less than or equal to the given step. If there is no key, returns the first key instead of null.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the key
      See Also:
      TreeSet.floor(Object), TreeSet.first()

    • reverse

      public Gradient reverse​(java.util.List<ColorKey> keyList)
      Reverses the gradient. The step of each color key is subtracted from one. Does so with a temporary List.
      Parameters:
      keyList - a temp list
      Returns:
      the gradient
      See Also:
      List.clear(), List.addAll(java.util.Collection), TreeSet.addAll(java.util.Collection), TreeSet.clear(), Collections.reverse(java.util.List)
